title: GM Plans More Than $3 Billion for Electric-Vehicle Projects in Michigan
sub_head: Auto maker to convert suburban Detroit factory for electric trucks and plans battery-cell factory with LG
body:
General Motors Co. plans to invest more than $3 billion to make electric vehicles in Michigan, people familiar with the matter said, a potential win for the car makerâ€™s home state after recent commitments of auto projects to Southern states.
GM is finalizing plans for two electric-vehicle projects in Michigan. One would convert its Orion Assembly plant in suburban Detroit to serve as its hub for production of electric pickup trucks, the people with knowledge of the plans said. The renovation would cost at least $2 billion and would be expected to create more than 1,500 jobs at the factory, which today is lightly used, the people said.
